pageContent: Objective: Prostate cancer is the commonest cancer in men in France, and its incidence increases with age. It occupies 4th place in terms of mortality. The Limousin region, with the oldest population in France, established a regional registry of new cases of cancers in 1998. The objective of this study was to analyse the prostate cancer incidence and mortality data in the Limousin region for 1998.

metaData.source:
Mutational Profile of Aggressive, Localised Prostate Cancer from African Caribbean Men Versus European Ancestry Men
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/30245085/
